page.content: {St. Margaret's}church is Roman Catholic. It has been used as a church since 1964. Before this it was used as a school. In 1978 it was extended by John Turnbull and reopened as St. Margaret's in 1980. It is named after St. Margaret Ward, a maid servant of the 16th century. She helped a prisoner escape in 1588 and was hung. The church holds 180 people. Wet rot is a problem. People who attend this church vary from 3 to 92 years old. There is Mass on Thursday evening and Sunday morning, Sunday School is on Saturday morning. Every Sunday about Â£100 is raised, this is used for the upkeep of St. Margaret's, to pay Father Marmion and money is also sent to various charities.
